page.title: 04HOW RISELEY IS ADMINISTERED
page.content: The Parish Council, consisting of nine local residents, reflecting the views and needs of local people on all Parish matters, meets regularly once a month. It is concerned with the day to day running of the village, which includes arranging for the grassed areas around the village to be kept cut, maintenance of footpaths, street lighting, the brook and the allotments. The Parish Council has an annual precept of about Â£4000 and this is administered by the Clerk whose salary is around Â£700 per annum. He is the only paid member of the Parish Council. A Parochial Church Council, also elected from the congregation, runs All Saints Church affairs.
